## Remembering my childhood

In the warm embrace of my cozy bed,
Giving into the lulling desire,
My utmost worry on a foggy winter morning,
Was that warm cup of milk and delightful treats.

Oh how I reminisce, those carefree days,
Leaning into laziness, the luxury of languor.
When dreams were meant not to be realised,
But to be lost into, to explore the surreal!

When grandma's stories would weave the magic -
Of fairies and goblins, of myths and monster,
Without the hero's burden - of a world to save,
I would listen in awe, of these magical beings and sigh in embrace of their grandeur

Oh what would I give, to relive these days,
Immersed in the innocence of childhood memories,
When the hours were unhurried and idyllic,
When merry mornings and golden evenings, adorned the days of my life!
